abstract: Banks are slowly starting to agree to modify second mortgages for some struggling borrowers, but it’s not yet enough.
snippet: Banks are slowly starting to agree to modify second mortgages for some struggling borrowers, but it’s not yet enough.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase this week became the latest big bank to say it is willing to modify second mortgages for some struggling borrowers. While it’s a baby step in the right direction, it won’t do much to fix America’s foreclosure woes.

byline.original: By Rolfe Winkler and Robert Cyran

abstract: JPMorgan Chase is closing in on a deal with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. that could result in a tax refund of about $1.4 billion for the bank, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the talks.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is closing in on a deal with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. that could result in a tax refund of about $1.4 billion for the bank, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the talks.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is closing in on a deal with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. that could result in a tax refund of about $1.4 billion for the bank, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the talks.

headline.main: JPMorgan Eyes Tax Refund Deal, Report Says
